item.description:
Let’s get together for a fun and relaxing afternoon of kayaking in Newburyport.
* No experience necessary, as this will be a guided tour.

Where:
Plum Island Kayak
38R Merrimac Street - Unit 101 B
Newburyport, MA 01950
(978) 462-5510
http://www.plumisland...

* When you RSVP, please indicate that you have “Reserved” your kayak for the group trip.

Arrival Time:
Please arrive at Plum Island Kayak no later than 1:15pm, so that you have time sign in, be fitted for gear, and assigned to a kayak. We also need to allow time for them to transport us to our launch site. Launch site and kayaking route will be determined on that day based on tides, current and wind. We will launch at 2:00 and finish our paddle by 5:00pm.

Weather:
Rain or Shine… so we’ll keep our fingers crossed for a sunny day.

Price:
$55 per person - You'll need to call ASAP to reserve your kayak

* When you call to make your reservation, tell them that you are with the: "the Beantown Meetup Group"

* This is a joint event with the Social Fun Meetup Group. If you belong to both groups, please only RSVP "yes" on 1 of the groups

Dinner afterward:
Please indicate also in your RSVP if you plan to join us for dinner afterward at the Grog, which is walking distance from the municipal lot.

The Grog
13 Middle St
Newburyport, MA
http://www.thegrog.co...

* Plum Island Kayak's Cancellation Policy *
If you decide not to go, there is a 48 hr cancellation policy. You will need to call Plum Island Kayak to cancel your reservation so your card does not get charged.

Directions to Newburyport:
http://www.newburypor...

Parking:
There is a large free municipal lot at the corner of Green St, and Merrimac St.

Suggested Items to Bring:
Bathing suit
Sunglasses with neck cord
Fast drying synthetic clothing
Water shoes / sandles
Hat with visor
Large sponge (in case water gets inside your kayak)
Sun block
Bug repellent
Water bottle
Snacks
Lightweight waterproof jacket (if needed)
* a Towel
* And, bring a set of dry cloths to change into afterward.
* Also bring a waterproof bag ("drybag") to keep your belongings dry. Or you can use a large zip lock back and roll it up tight to prevent water from seeping inside.
Refer to this for a more specific list. http://www.plumisland...

Paddling Basics:
Tips, Safety, Essentials, Key Terms
http://www.perception...
item.how_to_find_us: I will meet you at Plum Island Kayak
item.name: Kayaking in Newburyport
